Class PlotSurface

    public class PlotSurface
extends PlotOptions
    Options for surface plot.

    • Field Detail

      • autocolorscale

        @Option
public Boolean autocolorscale
        Determines whether or not the color scale is picked using the sign of the input z values.

      • cauto

        @Option
public Boolean cauto
        Determines the whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data.

      • cmax

        @Option
public Integer cmax
        The upper bound of color domain.

      • cmin

        @Option
public Integer cmin
        The lower bound of color domain.

      • colorbar

        @Option
public final ColorbarOptions colorbar
        Options for color bar display.

      • colorscale$array

        @Option(value="colorscale")
public Object[] colorscale$array
        The colorscale and only has an effect if "color" is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, "[[0, "rgb(0,0,255)", [1, "rgb(255,0,0)"]]". To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use "cmin" and "cmax".

      • colorscale$string

        @Option(value="colorscale")
public String colorscale$string
        Alternatively, "colorscale" may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys, YlGnBu, Greens, YlOrRd, Bluered, RdBu, Reds, Blues, Picnic, Rainbow, Portland, Jet, Hot, Blackbody, Earth, Electric, Viridis, Cividis

      • contours_x

        @Option(value="contours.x")
public final ContourOptions contours_x
        Controls the display of the x contours.

      • contours_y

        @Option(value="contours.y")
public final ContourOptions contours_y
        Controls the display of the y contours.

      • contours_z

        @Option(value="contours.z")
public final ContourOptions contours_z
        Controls the display of the z contours.

      • hidesurface

        @Option
public Boolean hidesurface
        Determines whether or not a surface is drawn. For example, set "hidesurface" to "false" "contours.x.show" to "true" and "contours.y.show" to "true" to draw a wire frame plot.

      • lighting

        @Option
public final LightingOptions lighting
        Options for lighting effect.

      • lightposition_x

        @Option(value="lightposition.x")
public Double lightposition_x
        Numeric vector, representing the X coordinate for each vertex.

        Constraints: ≥-100000 and ≤100000

        Default: 10

      • lightposition_y

        @Option(value="lightposition.y")
public Double lightposition_y
        Numeric vector, representing the Y coordinate for each vertex. *

        Constraints: ≥-100000 and ≤100000

        Default: 10000

      • lightposition_z

        @Option(value="lightposition.z")
public Double lightposition_z
        Numeric vector, representing the Z coordinate for each vertex. *

        Constraints: ≥-100000 and ≤100000

        Default: 0

      • reversescale

        @Option
public Boolean reversescale
        Reverses the colorscale.

      • scene

        @Option
public String scene
        Reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If "scene" (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to "layout.scene". If "scene2", the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to "layout.scene2", and so on.

      • showscale

        @Option
public Boolean showscale
        Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

        Default: true

      • surfacecolor

        @Option
public String surfacecolor
        The surface fill color.

      • text$array

        @Option(value="text")
public String[] text$array
        The text elements associated with each z value. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • text$string

        @Option(value="text")
public String text$string
        The text elements associated with each z value to the same value. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • x

        @Option
public Object[] x
        Data points for x-axis.

      • x$number

        @Option(value="x")
public double[] x$number
        Data points for x-axis. Alternate form for numeric data.

      • xcalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum xcalendar
        The calendar system to use with "x" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN

      • y

        @Option
public Object[] y
        Data points for y-axis.

      • y$number

        @Option(value="y")
public double[] y$number
        Data points for y-axis. Alternate form for numeric data.

      • ycalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum ycalendar
        The calendar system to use with "y" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN

      • z

        @Option
public Object[] z
        Data points for z-axis.

      • z$number

        @Option(value="z")
public double[] z$number
        Data points for z-axis. Alternate form for numeric data.

      • zcalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum zcalendar
        The calendar system to use with "z" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN
